message.content:
cs.CL, cs.HC, cs.SD, cs.IR, cs.LG

Reasoning: 
- cs.CL (Computation and Language): The paper focuses on comparing two text entry methods, one of which is speech recognition, which falls under the domain of natural language processing. 
- cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction): The study evaluates the performance of two text entry methods on touchscreen phones, which is a topic related to human-computer interaction. 
- cs.SD (Sound): The paper uses speech recognition as one of the text entry methods, which involves processing sound signals. 
- cs.IR (Information Retrieval): The paper evaluates the performance of two text entry methods in terms of input rate and error rate, which are metrics commonly used in information retrieval. 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper uses Baidu's Deep Speech 2, a deep learning-based speech recognition system, which falls under the domain of machine learning.
